author: Stepgie Community Member
title: Re: Google Nest Audio Bricked
text:
3 weeks ago
Hi, looking to get resolution on a bricked Nest Audio.
Some background: I came home after work on Dec 7 and found my Nest Audio unresponsive. I have a nest thermostat, home mini, and a nest hub in the same house that are working fine, only the Nest Audio was unresponsive.
Actions taken: I tried to reboot the unresponsive Nest Audio, the white dots flashed briefly, then nothing. Tried to reboot again, no response. I checked the outlet with another Google home device, and the outlet is fine. I used another power adapter that I confirmed works with other units on the affected Nest Audio, and still no response.
Online chat has generally been unhelpful, offering nothing else but "product is out of warranty, buy a new one". I was wondering if anyone here has a solution. Was there a recent update that bricked my device?
Thanks,
Answered!
Go to the Recommended Answer.
a week ago
Hi @stepgie!
This situation needs further assistance; please fill out this form with all the necessary information, like the thread title or link and your username in the community. Once you've completed the form, let me know. Someone from my team will contact you shortly to help.
Best regards,
Jeremy.
3 weeks ago
By reboot, do you mean the factory reset process?
https://support.google.com/googlenest/answer/7073477?hl=en&sjid=12197963292752931145-NC#zippy=%2Cgoogle-nest-audio
3 weeks ago
Yes, I attempted it but now there’s no response. No lights turn on, no indication that it’s powered up.
2 weeks ago
Hi @stepgie!
Thanks for reaching out to the community. I am sorry to hear that your Google Nest Audio is bricked, but no need to worry; help is here. Thank you for all the troubleshooting steps that you did at the same time. Thank you for your support as well @MplsCustomer. I need to know a few things about your Nest Audio in order to provide you with a better resolution.
I'll be waiting for your response; any additional details you can provide will be helpful.
Best regards,
Jeremy.
2 weeks ago
Hi Jeremy,
I ruled out the outlet, and I ruled out the Nest Audio's power adapter, leaving only the actual Nest Audio unit as the source of the issue imo.
a week ago

Thanks for your reply and the information shared. As you have already tried to reset your device, we will need to follow these extra troubleshooting steps:
Tell me how it goes.
Regards,
Jeremy.
